moves.1. d4 b5: Polish Defense, I just felt like playing something different.
moves.2. Nc3 a6 3. e4 e6 4. Nf3 d5 5. a3: I was expecting white to play Bg5 forcing an exchange with my bishop and subsequently drawing my Knight to e7 or Queen to the same square.
moves.5... dxe4 6. Nxe4 Bb7: I decided to put pressure on his knight, expecting Ng3, but again I was wrong...
moves.7. Bd3: White chose to develop his light square bishop to protect the knight.  Not a bad move, just not what I was expecting.
moves.7... Nd7: I had visions of Ngf6 as my next move, and then attack, but...
moves.9... Ngf6 10. Ned2 c5: I figured it was time to attack the center.
moves.11. O-O: A good move to castle, but now I've got one barrel pointed at his king, and soon possibly two.
moves.11... c4: I might have made a mistake, but I didn't see white taking c5 any time soon, and I thought I would pin his Bishop and close in his queen
moves.13. c3 Qc6: I've temporarily pinned white's knight on f3 with a mate threat
moves.14. b3 Nd5: My target is the light square bishop after the pawn on c3, this was merely a diversion to move the dark square bishop
moves.15. Ne5: Ne5?, I think better was Bg3, but I'll take it.
moves.15... Nxe5 16. Bxe5 Nxc3: Now I'm at least a pawn up, but I saw his light square bishop as a new problem
moves.17. Bf3: There it is, about to ruin my whole plan...
moves.17... Qd7 18. Qc2: Bxb7 was definitely the play to eliminate the threat, but I will take it.
moves.18... Bxf3 19. Bxg7: Nxf3 was better, now I saw where I could gain a distinct advantage if not mate with the following...
moves.19... Ne2+ 20. Kh1 Bxg2+: A necessary sacrifice to get my queen in the game and create a possible mating sequence
moves.21. Kxg2 Qd5+ 22. f3: I think better was trading queens, and possibly losing the bishop
moves.22... Qg5+: Now I am definitely thinking of a mating solution
moves.23. Kf2 Nf4: I have a mating solution if white does not make a proper move.
moves.24. Bxh8: Not proper, and the mating solution is 3... pretty easy to see in my opinion
moves.24... Qg2+ 25. Ke3: only move to stave off mate for one additional move
moves.26... Qe2#: I think it is an interesting looking mate.

gameName: Polish Defense with Bishop Sac, Cool Looking Mate
